questions.guidance_text: Enter your business's complete legal name as registered with authorities. This should match your GST registration, incorporation certificate, or professional license exactly.
Provide your complete registered office address including building, street, locality, city, state and pincode. This address will be used for all policy documentation and legal correspondence.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 301, Sunshine Plaza, MG Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka - 560001

questions.guidance_text: Enter the name and title of the authorized person managing this insurance. This person should have decision-making authority and will receive all policy-related communications.
Indicate if your business is formally registered as a company, partnership, LLP, or proprietorship. Registered businesses typically get better insurance terms than unregistered ones.
Enter how many years your business has been operating. Established businesses with longer track records often receive more favorable premium rates due to proven expertise.

questions.question_text: Do You Have Employees (Full-time or Part-time)?
questions.guidance_text: Indicate if you have any employees including full-time, part-time, or contract staff. Employee errors are covered under your professional liability, affecting your risk profile.
Enter the total number of employees if applicable. More employees mean higher exposure to professional errors, which impacts your premium calculation.
Describe all professional services your business provides. Be comprehensive as coverage is limited to declared services. Include consulting, advisory, design, or any professional expertise you offer.
questions.placeholder: e.g., We provide financial consulting, tax advisory, audit services, and business valuation services to SMEs and corporates...

questions.question_text: Do You Provide Any Professional Advice or Consultancy?
questions.guidance_text: Professional advice includes recommendations, opinions, or guidance provided based on your expertise. This carries higher liability as clients rely on your advice for business decisions.

questions.question_text: Do You Use Any Special Products, Chemicals, or Equipment?
questions.guidance_text: Indicate if your services involve specialized tools, hazardous materials, or technical equipment. These may require additional coverage for property damage or bodily injury risks.

questions.question_text: Annual Turnover for Last Financial Year
questions.guidance_text: Enter your total revenue for the previous financial year in rupees. Premium is typically calculated as a percentage of turnover, so accurate figures ensure appropriate coverage and fair pricing.

questions.question_text: Estimated Annual Turnover for Current Year
questions.guidance_text: Enter your projected revenue for the current financial year. If your actual turnover exceeds estimates significantly, you must inform the insurer to maintain valid coverage.

questions.question_text: Do You Currently Have Professional Indemnity Insurance?
questions.guidance_text: Indicate if you have active PI insurance. Continuous coverage history helps maintain retroactive coverage for past work and may qualify you for no-claim bonuses.
If currently insured, provide your insurance company's name. This helps in policy portability and transferring any accumulated benefits to your new policy.
Provide your current policy's expiration date to ensure seamless coverage transition. Gap in coverage can expose you to claims for work done during the uninsured period.

questions.question_text: Any Claims Made in the Last 5 Years?
questions.guidance_text: Declare all professional liability claims or complaints in the past 5 years. Claims history affects premium rates but non-disclosure can void your entire policy coverage.
If you've had claims, provide details including date, nature of claim, amount claimed, and settlement status. Full disclosure helps insurers accurately assess and price your risk.
questions.placeholder: e.g., March 2023 - Client claimed losses due to incorrect tax advice. Claim amount: ₹5 lakhs. Settled for ₹2 lakhs.

questions.guidance_text: Select the maximum amount the insurer will pay for all claims during the policy period. Choose based on your largest contracts and potential client losses from professional errors. Higher limits provide better protection. You can enter the amount in lakhs or crores (e.g., 50,00,000 or 5,00,00,000).

Deductible is your out-of-pocket expense per claim before insurance pays. Higher deductibles reduce premiums but increase your financial responsibility during claims. Choose based on your risk appetite. You can enter the amount in lakhs or crores (e.g., 50,00,000 or 5,00,00,000).

Select where you need coverage for professional liability claims. If you serve international clients, ensure coverage extends to their jurisdictions. USA/Canada coverage significantly increases premiums.

Select your business structure as legally registered. Different entity types have varying liability exposures - companies have limited liability while proprietorships have unlimited personal liability.

If your profession requires licensing (like CA, CS, architect, doctor), provide your registration number. Licensed professionals may get specific coverage benefits but also have higher standards of care.
Provide your 15-character GST number if registered. This helps verify your business details and may be required for input tax credit on insurance premium under GST.
Enter your business PAN (Permanent Account Number). This 10-character code is mandatory for insurance policies and helps in verification and tax compliance.
Mention any unique aspects of your business, special coverage needs, or additional information that would help insurers understand your risk profile better and offer appropriate coverage.
questions.placeholder: e.g., We work extensively with government contracts and need coverage for penalty clauses...
